content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Facility at position(x=-10.0, y=-50.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Furnace at position(x=-10.0, y=-50.0) fueled with coal.
- Burner Inserter at position(x=-10.5, y=-48.5) transferring items to the furnace.
- Burner Inserter at position(x=-7.5, y=-49.5) transferring items to a wooden chest.
- Burner Inserter at position(x=-5.5, y=-49.5) awaiting items for transfer.
- Wooden Chest at position(x=-8.5, y=-49.5) for storage.

### Iron Ore Mining Operation at position(x=-14.0, y=-53.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position(x=-14.0, y=-53.0) extracting iron ore.
- BeltGroup connecting the mining drill to other parts of the production line.

### Belt System
Consists of multiple BeltGroups and individual belts:
- BeltGroup with inputs from position(x=-21.5, y=-51.5) to (x=-19.5, y=-51.5) and outputs from (x=-18.5, y=-49.5) to (x=-16.5, y=-49.5).
- BeltGroup with inputs from position(x=-17.5, y=-50.5) to (x=-17.5, y=-52.5) and outputs from (x=-16.5, y=-55.5) to (x=-14.5, y=-55.5).
- Individual belts connecting various parts of the production line.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when connecting belts directly to entities
- Ensure you use an inserter when attempting to connect belts to entities like Stone Furnace or Wooden Chest. Belts cannot be directly connected to these entities.

### Errors due to insufficient inventory items
- Before attempting to insert items into entities, verify that you have the necessary items in your inventory to avoid insertion errors.

### Errors when refueling entities without sufficient fuel
- Always check your inventory for sufficient fuel before attempting to refuel entities like mining drills and furnaces to prevent operation failures.
